trans-unit.source: This must be the same value passed to _WinAPI_ShellUserAuthenticationDlg() function.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the credentials returned from the prompt function are valid, valid values:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies whether the credentials returned from the prompt function are valid, valid values:

target.mrk: Specifies whether the credentials returned from the prompt function are valid, valid values:

trans-unit.source: True - The credentials are stored in the credential manager.

seg-source.mrk: True - The credentials are stored in the credential manager.

target.mrk: True - The credentials are stored in the credential manager.

trans-unit.source: False - The credentials are not stored and various pieces of memory are cleaned up.

seg-source.mrk: False - The credentials are not stored and various pieces of memory are cleaned up.

target.mrk: False - The credentials are not stored and various pieces of memory are cleaned up.

trans-unit.source: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero, @extended flag may contain the system error code.

trans-unit.source: This function function must be called after each successful call to _WinAPI_ShellUserAuthenticationDlg() with the $CREDUI_FLAGS_EXPECT_CONFIRMATION flag set.

trans-unit.source: To continue, type a login and password, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: You have typed an incorrect login or password, it should be "AutoIt" and "123".

trans-unit.source: If the flag is set to True then encrypt, otherwise decrypt.
